I really like how you came through. didn't expect the post to be so calm about it.
It blows my mind, how can Riot's balance think, that it's ok for Garen or Darius exist in the same game as someone like Kalista.

The thing that really gets me is that darius and kalista have the exact opposite problem. Darius has no mobility resulting in being garbage in high elo where people are better at kiting and has completely rock paper scissors interactions based on who he can reach.

I thought riot learned their lesson but then the same designer releases kalista, who has infinite mobility resulting in being completely broken in high elo where people can use her to kite and has rock paper scissors interactions based on who can reach her.

I can understand making mistakes but jesus at least try to learn from them.
Well that is CertainlyT for you, can't understand the concept of balance for shit

The funniest thing is that one of them is his earliest creation and the other is his latest.

LoL and CertainlyToxic.

I know. Garen and Darius are so broken. I mean, I was playing as a kalista versus darius the other day, and when I tried to get him to kite me he just turned and fought the rest of my team. A few weeks ago I was up against Garen, and he backed off every time I hopped back instead of chasing. It was totally unfair.
Real Kalista mains woulda maintained the max range distance since it is further than Darius' pull range and you can easily outhop Garen's Q MS.

> [{quoted}](name=Sleeper Cell,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=OYul6w3Q,comment-id=000700000000,timestamp=2015-02-22T20:04:59.460+0000)
>
> Real Kalista mains woulda maintained the max range distance since it is further than Darius' pull range and you can easily outhop Garen's Q MS.

I'm not saying I agree with Test Account, but you missed his/her point. If you run at kalista and she jumps away, you turn around and fight her team instead of chasing. She jumps further when jumping away, so she now has to waste time walking back into the teamfight since she hopped out of AA range.

If they go that stupid hurricane build, just having a tank run at her until she hops away then turning around is actually a decent way to keep her impact at a minimum. The build lacks heavy single-target damage, and Kalista doesn't have a steroid outide her W proc, which does magic damage. So she actually has a hell of a time actually killing a tank that doesn't just chase her endlessly.

Still would not recommend taking Garen vs. her.

No my friend, *you* missed *my* point.

> Real Kalista mains woulda **maintained the max range distance** since it is further than Darius' pull range and you can easily outhop Garen's Q MS.

Aka stayed in range at max range aka stayed in the fight.

the point isnt a good one. 

okay -  she kites back and  is out of the fight. then you turn back on the enemy team. 

but a good kalista wont jump STRAIGHT backwards. she kites from side to side. you turn back? great! Q, jump forward. if kalista gets a single auto off, she is right back in the fight with you. what if she doesnt get that auto off? well, she misses out on a couple autos  to reposition herself (what any other adc has to do, excluding vayne) and is back in the fight. 

and this is assuming that you have the chance to chase her down (no peel from the support, no front line you have to get through). and assuming that she doesnt rip those rend stacks from all that chasing so you die when you get back into the fight.
As a rammus/Hecarim jungler, MS boosts dont matter against her. :(

As a Pantheon Jungler, SPARTAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA

but on a more serious note yea they need to fix her passive so that it doesn't make every champion obsolete even when they do prep a trap
Whats worse is when you're a sticky jungler like Xin and she STILL avoids you through a slow charge.
right because Slows=OP for ranged champs but do next to shit for melee's when they have them in their kits
The 'flash every second' kinda makes slows irrelevant. It really shouldnt have made it past testing. =/
If kalista is in a game then it should be that every champion with a gap-closer has 100% cdr on it just so that it's somewhere in the ball park of "fair gameplay" and "balanced kits"
Honestly some get close, Xin's E gets close to directional dash every three seconds, she just covers SO much ground.

I remember someone suggesting that Slows affect dashes which I believe that would effectively nerf Kalista's passive but only very slightly, if Riot wanted to balance her then they would probably need to scrap her passive and maybe take the passive from her W and use that as her kit passive. Since the mark applies every 6 seconds and cannot be re-applied this would make for a better passive while the mobility portion of her kit can be moved towards her Q while giving it a slightly better CD than the current 8 seconds. That's my thoughts on it but since I'm not an ADC main I can't give much on it other than a personal analysis from playing with and against Kalista's in Solo Que

But then Riot would have to admit that they were wrong in their original design values. We will have to wait two years before they rework her, saying she BECAME unhealthy in the meta of that time. Assuming they don't make champions with even more broken mobility.
